info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 4:52PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Archuleta County through 515 PM MDT... At 450 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 17 miles southeast of Pagosa Springs, or 20 miles northwest of Chama. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. Heavy rain can also be expected with this thunderstorm. SOURCE...Satellite and radar estimates. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Archuleta County. This includes U.S. Highway 84 in Colorado between mile markers 6 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
